required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Naproxen on Tooth Sensitivity Caused by In-office Bleaching
clinical_study.official_title: Rior Use of Naproxen on Tooth Sensitivity Reduction After In-office Bleaching: Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effects of prior use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory Naproxen on risk and level of tooth sensitivity caused by in-office bleaching procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk to Tooth sensitivity - during procedure
primary_outcome.description: The tooth sensitivity will be evaluated using a 5-point Verbal rating scale (VRS), where 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = considerable and 4 = severe. Score different from 0 will determine presence of sensitivity. The risk of tooth sensitivity will be determined by relative risk assessed by ratio between absolute risk of experimental condition by those observed in control. The 95% confidence interval will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of tooth sensitivity - during procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The tooth sensitivity will be evaluated using a 5-point Verbal rating scale (VRS), where 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = considerable and 4 = severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk of tooth sensitivity - after procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The tooth sensitivity will be evaluated using a 5-point Verbal rating scale (VRS), where 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = considerable and 4 = severe. Score different from 0 will determine presence of sensitivity. The risk of tooth sensitivity will be determined by relative risk assessed by ratio between absolute risk of experimental condition by those observed in control. The 95% confidence interval will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of tooth sensitivity - after procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The tooth sensitivity will be evaluated using a 5-point Verbal rating scale (VRS), where 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, 3 = considerable and 4 = severe.

other_outcome.description: A spectrophotometer will be used to assess the color alteration, while the parameter "L", "a" and "b" will be recorded.

intervention.description: The patient will receive a single-dose of Naproxen (500 mg) one hour before the bleaching procedure.
